channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @hannahofhameln The connection is that yeshiva trained educators think that their superior Talmudic knowledge makes them smarter than everyone else, when in fact they are incapable of responding wisely to real world problems.
@datadivajf Shavua Tov!
@MitchSchindler The question is how to organize without, and sometimes despite, the Party, which has convinced itself that silence is the best policy in the face of a rising fascist tide.
Recruited by Don Was to play acoustic guitar for re-recording of classic songs. Fascinating portrait of Bob as an impatient perfectionist. https://t.co/XYKodDG8gz

Important post highlighting multiple policy failures by multiple Orthodox schools. https://t.co/VwmuNl6KVN
Also, a useful rejoinder to those who would argue that Talmud study is “substantively equivalent” to any form of practical education.

@MattNegrin @froomkin No. Because fascists are part of the community of “people like us and therefore fundamentally good” for their owners and advertisers and many of the editors and writers the owners hire.
@MattNegrin @froomkin The fundamental mistake is thinking that the Times et al are fundamentally different than, say, a parochial Jewish newspaper with multiple affiliation to established Jewish institutions.
@BenYehudaPress Big fan of the double yod symbol — does it have its own name?

Very cool to see. https://t.co/8DDZJkjpbD
I interviewed @yael_kanarek about her Regendered Bible project last year: https://t.co/YxL8lCTrn9

Looking forward to @RabbiShmuley / Ted Nugent summit. https://t.co/j9J2OpF1cK
Reminder: https://t.co/K53wOonb9l
@steveniweiss @mwecker What make you think that Bennett made the call to influence Zelenskyy rather than to influence Putin?
@EladNehorai https://t.co/c30ji5es3j
False dichotomies: Threat or menace? https://t.co/8DRaiA109Q
@MisfitTorah Not to mention the strong possibility that it existed as a memorized document for a few centuries.
Your occasional reminder that David Brooks was co-recipient of the first Jewish Week Excellence in Journalism Award. https://t.co/YaalL7Ghaa

Every time we fail to hold decision makers responsible for bad decisions, we increase the incentives for bad decision making. https://t.co/SLVyfB6uvF
Compare the outrage over the Iran Deal to the subsequent lack of outrage when Iran predictably increased its enrichment of uranium after Trump pulled out of the deal on Bibi’s urging.
Now, the same group of people are about to restart their outrage machine as Biden attempts to restore the deal to reduce Iran’s nuclear threat.
Consider that for many people squawking the loudest, averting a nuclear attack on Tel Aviv may not, in fact, be their matter of highest concern.

Your occasional reminder that the Republican war against fuel efficiency (and closing the small truck regulatory loophole) is one of the ways conservatives helped make Putin great. https://t.co/IjiBR6BMii
Interesting thread revealing, inter alia, how the neocon project whitewashed antisemitism long before anti-anti-Trumpism was a gleam in Roger Hertog’s eye. https://t.co/1HsAeyNaLm
@Lexaphus Maybe Haman too is wrongly misunderstood?
@swordsjew A nonsensical explanation is nearly as useful as a sensical explanation, and far easier to create.

@EladNehorai Your mistake is forgetting that the NYTimes is as embedded in a community that includes Republicans as assuredly as my paper is embedded in a community that includes AIPAC supporters, YU alumni, and people who daven at Chabad.
@Elishabenabuya @Shmarya שלום חנוך צדק. https://t.co/ynfkSV7Izg
@HannahLebovits Surely there’s a Shmiras Einaim foundation that would pay you to read that ad.
“You talk of ‘human’ rights. Listen to you. Even your language is racist.” https://t.co/fGzr5ImXpm
@marcrod97 Is the same Senator Cruz who reportedly held up Iron Dome funding for months?
